Um foi de uma luta com sabre laser que eu fiz com meu amigo Thiago (na verdade, ele fez a maior parte da parada, ele que me ensinou como se faz) e depois eu fiz um v√≠deo com um efeito de poder tipo o Kame Hame Ha. previous.excerpt: Sometimes I realize that I‚Äôm not just a useless information‚Ä¶
previous.html:
Sometimes I realize that I‚Äôm not just a useless information source and I remember that I‚Äôve done some pretty cool stuff! An exemple of that are the effects that I‚Äôve done with Adobe Photoshop + Adobe Premiere. One of them is a lightsaber fight that I‚Äôve done with my friend Thiago (actually he did the bigger part of it, I just learned how to do it) and another one is a power effect just like Kame Hame Ha . It‚Äôs actually quite good, watch the two videos below:

This one (just below) I made for a TV show called Descarga MTV! It was on the show and everything, awesome, watch below:
previous.rawMarkdownBody:
Sometimes I realize that I'm not just a useless information source and I remember that I've done some pretty cool stuff! An exemple of that are the effects that I've done with [Adobe Photoshop](http://www.adobe.com/br/products/photoshop/ "Adobe Photoshop") + [Adobe Premiere](http://www.adobe.com/br/products/premiere/ "Site oficial"). One of them is a lightsaber fight that I've done with my friend Thiago (actually he did the bigger part of it, I just learned how to do it) and another one is a power effect just like [Kame Hame Ha](http://pt.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kame_hame_ha "Kame Hame Ha no Wikip√©dia") . It's actually quite good, watch the two videos below:

`youtube: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=q6LpZMhu-L0`

`youtube: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=psCb67mHjAk`

This one (just below) I made for a TV show called [Descarga MTV](http://twitter.com/descargamtv "Descarga MTV no Twitter")! It was on the show and everything, awesome, watch below:

`youtube: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NWwKs6cV7-4`

next.excerpt: Did you see this post‚Äôs title? Yes, I‚Äôm going to talk about‚Ä¶
next.html:
Did you see this post‚Äôs title? Yes, I‚Äôm going to talk about a really discussed subject that exists on any forum/blog/fotolog/twitter/bar/museum/school on the world: The timeline of Zelda . Is there really one? Why does Shigeru Miyamoto loves to do those mind blower s that lets everybody INSANE? If you lost your hopes trying to find a correct timeline for Zelda, I hope that this post will put you back on track in the way of hope and that one day we‚Äôll understand the universe of Zelda and its timeline.

To start, watch this video:

Now that you‚Äôre finished you must be thinking: ‚ÄúWOW, AWSOME!‚Äù, just like me and others. Some months after this new theory‚Äôs been created, the video‚Äôs author sent it to Nintendo, asking if he got any close to a solution to the timeline of Zelda, and Nintendo answered this:Resuming: are we screwed? No, not at all. What happened here?

Someone really addicted to Zelda searched a little bit, was able to make lots of connections between Zelda games and made this really famous video on YouTube, and when he got in contact with Nintendo, got the response that there was no timeline on Zelda.

Well, I was really upset with Nintendo‚Äôs response, and resolved to e-mail them. I wrote about the contact between ocarinahero10 and its videos, I talked about what Miyamoto himself said once, that there are two timelines on Zelda and even quote the Zeldas that have official sequences ( Zelda -> Zelda II ; Ocarina of Time -> Majora‚Äôs Mask ; Wind Waker -> Phantom Hourglass ; Oracle of Seasons -> Oracle of Ages ), and here‚Äôs the answer of Nintendo.

Hello Pablo,

Since the first Legend of Zelda game was released on the NES years ago, fans of the series have tried to fit each game into a timeline, each game representing a separate episode of Link‚Äôs life. This has lead to much speculation and discussion, particularly over the games where Link switches between adult and young boy.

The 2003 release of The Legend of Zelda: The Wind Waker finally put an end to the speculation and discussion in its opening line, ‚ÄúThis is but one of the legends of which people speak‚Ä¶‚Äù The basic assumption has always been that Link is a single individual. However, in an interview given at the time it was released, the game‚Äôs director, Eiji Aonuma (speaking for himself and Shigeru Miyamoto, the original creator of the series) stated ‚ÄúIn our opinions, with the Legend of Zelda, every game has a new Link. A new hero named Link always rises to fight evil.‚Äù

This means that‚Äìunless otherwise specified‚Äìeach new game represents a new Link and that there isn‚Äôt a true frame of reference or timeline possible for the series. For additional information on The Legend of Zelda series, please visit our official Legend of Zelda website at the following address:

www.zelda.com/universe/

Sincerely,

Sharon Matheny

Nintendo of America Inc.

Nintendo‚Äôs home page: http://www.nintendo.com/

Power Line (Automated Product Info): (425) 885-7529

Uhmn, wait a minute‚Ä¶ I‚Äôve seen that response somewhere‚Ä¶ right! I got the same response that on ocarinahero10, but what does this means? It means that Nintendo‚Äôs website has a system that identifies the words ‚ÄúZelda‚Äù and ‚Äútimeline‚Äù and doesn‚Äôt even bother to read what you say, and send you that automatic e-mail. Kind of boring, right? So I give it a GOOD look on the internet about Miyamoto saying that there is a chronological sequence on Zelda, and I did find it, here it is Miyamoto‚Äôs statement:

‚ÄúOcarina of Time is the first story, then the original Legend of Zelda, then Zelda II: The Adventure of Link, and finally A Link to the Past. It‚Äôs not very clear where Link‚Äôs Awakening fits in‚Äìit could be anytime after Ocarina of Time.‚Äù

And his one from Eiji Aonuma:

‚ÄúAs for the timeline, Twilight Princess is set several hundred years after Link has fought Ganondorf in Ocarina of Time and returned to his own time (the OoT ending), and becomes a parallel world to The Wind Waker (the time axis originally splits in Ocarina of Time and a parallel timeline is formed). Wind Waker begins several hundred years immediately after adult Link seals away Ganondorf, Twilight Princess occurs several hundred years after the adult Link is sent back to his original time by Zelda‚Äôs power.‚Äù

Two powerful quotes spoken by who‚Äôs behind the game, which proves that Zelda HAS a timeline =D And now that you‚Äôre finishing reading this post, you‚Äôre very happy hearing such news, but there is one problem: sources.

All sources of those information, were took from blogs and websites about Zelda, so how can we tell they‚Äôre true? Well, I searched a little bit about the sources, I spent like 5 hours searching where the first quote was from, and I found out that it came from an exclusive interview with Miyamoto to a magazine called Nintendo Power in November of 1998, click here to read it.

This interview was published on January of 1999 in a special edition of Nintendo Power #116, the edition that only who have a subscription of the magazine gets it. I searched on eBay for that special edition but I didn‚Äôt find it =( So I e-mailed Nintendo Power and Nintendo with the link of the interview, asking if it‚Äôs really true, and they answered yes!

So the first quote about Ocarina of Time being the first Zelda ever it‚Äôs true and was Miyamoto himself who said it =D The source of the second quote was a lot easier to find, I searched on the official website of Nintendo Dream, japanese magazine of Nintendo, and I found the edition that has that quote, to access the interview (in japanese) click here, and to see the translation (english by Google translator ) click here.

You can also check the translated version by Patricia and TSA, from thehylia.com/ by clicking here.

There, job done! Zelda POSSESSES a timeline, we only have to wait for Shigeru Miyamoto on Wikip√©dia to start launching new games of Official website that are connected to the ones that already exist.

Zelda is an adventure game, really rich in puzzles, which, for who is more addicted to it, brings a fantasy story like no other before.

We‚Äôll keep on playing Zelda to the end of times o/

Also check out the Zelda Timeline secret page I have on this blog.
next.rawMarkdownBody:
![zelda timeline](../../uploads/blog/2009/09/zelda_timeline.jpg "Timeline?")

Did you see this post's title? Yes, I'm going to talk about a really discussed subject that exists on any forum/blog/fotolog/twitter/bar/museum/school on the world: The timeline of [Zelda](http://zelda.com/ "Official website") . Is there really one? Why does [Shigeru Miyamoto](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shigeru_Miyamoto "Shigeru Miyamoto on Wikip√©dia") loves to do those mind blower s that lets everybody INSANE? If you lost your hopes trying to find a correct timeline for [Zelda](http://zelda.com/ "Official website"), I hope that this post will put you back on track in the way of hope and that one day we'll understand the universe of [Zelda](http://zelda.com/ "Official website") and its timeline.

To start, watch this video:

`youtube: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=F2g65jL3HDg`

Now that you're finished you must be thinking: "WOW, AWSOME!", just like me and others. Some months after this new theory's been created, the video's author sent it to [Nintendo](http://nintendo.com/ "Official website"), asking if he got any close to a solution to the timeline of [Zelda](http://zelda.com/ "Official website"), and [Nintendo](http://nintendo.com/ "Official website") answered this:Resuming: are we screwed? No, not at all. What happened here?

Someone really addicted to [Zelda](http://zelda.com/ "Official website") searched a little bit, was able to make lots of connections between [Zelda](http://zelda.com/ "Official website") games and made this really famous video on [YouTube](http://youtube.com/ "Official website"), and when he got in contact with [Nintendo](http://nintendo.com/ "Official website"), got the response that there was no timeline on [Zelda](http://zelda.com/ "Official website").

Well, I was really upset with [Nintendo's](http://nintendo.com/ "Official website") response, and resolved to e-mail them. I wrote about the contact between [ocarinahero10](http://www.youtube.com/ocarinahero10 "ocarinahero10 on YouTube") and its videos, I talked about what [Miyamoto](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shigeru_Miyamoto "Shigeru Miyamoto on Wikip√©dia") himself said once, that there are two timelines on [Zelda](http://zelda.com/ "Official website") and even quote the [Zeldas](http://zelda.com/ "Official website") that have official sequences ( [Zelda](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Legend_of_Zelda_(video_game) "Official website") -> [Zelda II](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zelda_II:_The_Adventure_of_Link "Zelda II on Wikip√©dia") ; [Ocarina of Time](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ocarina_of_Time "Ocarina of Time on Wikip√©dia") -> [Majora's Mask](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Legend_of_Zelda:_Majora's_Mask "Majora's Mask on Wikip√©dia") ; [Wind Waker](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wind_Waker "Wind Waker on Wikip√©dia") -> [Phantom Hourglass](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Phantom_Hourglass "Phantom Hourglass on Wikip√©dia") ; [Oracle of Seasons](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oracle_of_Seasons "Oracle of Seasons on Wikip√©dia") -> [Oracle of Ages](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oracle_of_Ages "Oracle of Ages on Wikip√©dia") ), and here's the answer of [Nintendo](http://nintendo.com/ "Official website").

> Hello Pablo,
>
> Since the first Legend of Zelda game was released on the NES years ago, fans of the series have tried to fit each game into a timeline, each game representing a separate episode of Link's life. This has lead to much speculation and discussion, particularly over the games where Link switches between adult and young boy.
>
> The 2003 release of The Legend of Zelda: The Wind Waker finally put an end to the speculation and discussion in its opening line, "This is but one of the legends of which people speak..." The basic assumption has always been that Link is a single individual. However, in an interview given at the time it was released, the game's director, Eiji Aonuma (speaking for himself and Shigeru Miyamoto, the original creator of the series) stated "In our opinions, with the Legend of Zelda, every game has a new Link. A new hero named Link always rises to fight evil."
>
> This means that‚Äìunless otherwise specified‚Äìeach new game represents a new Link and that there isn't a true frame of reference or timeline possible for the series. For additional information on The Legend of Zelda series, please visit our official Legend of Zelda website at the following address:
>
> www.zelda.com/universe/
>
> Sincerely,
>
> Sharon Matheny
>
> Nintendo of America Inc.
>
> Nintendo's home page: http://www.nintendo.com/
>
> Power Line (Automated Product Info): (425) 885-7529

Uhmn, wait a minute... I've seen that response somewhere... right! I got the same response that on [ocarinahero10](http://www.youtube.com/ocarinahero10 "ocarinahero10 on YouTube"), but what does this means? It means that [Nintendo's](http://nintendo.com/ "official website") website has a system that identifies the words "Zelda" and "timeline" and doesn't even bother to read what you say, and send you that automatic e-mail. Kind of boring, right? So I give it a GOOD look on the internet about [Miyamoto](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shigeru_Miyamoto "Shigeru Miyamoto on Wikip√©dia") saying that there is a chronological sequence on [Zelda](http://zelda.com/ "official website"), and I did find it, here it is [Miyamoto's](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shigeru_Miyamoto "Shigeru Miyamoto on Wikip√©dia") statement:

> "Ocarina of Time is the first story, then the original Legend of Zelda, then Zelda II: The Adventure of Link, and finally A Link to the Past. It's not very clear where Link's Awakening fits in‚Äìit could be anytime after Ocarina of Time."

And his one from [Eiji Aonuma](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eiji_Aonuma "Eiji Aonuma on Wikip√©dia"):

> "As for the timeline, Twilight Princess is set several hundred years after Link has fought Ganondorf in Ocarina of Time and returned to his own time (the OoT ending), and becomes a parallel world to The Wind Waker (the time axis originally splits in Ocarina of Time and a parallel timeline is formed). Wind Waker begins several hundred years immediately after adult Link seals away Ganondorf, Twilight Princess occurs several hundred years after the adult Link is sent back to his original time by Zelda's power."

Two powerful quotes spoken by who's behind the game, which proves that [Zelda](http://zelda.com/ "official website") HAS a timeline =D And now that you're finishing reading this post, you're very happy hearing such news, but there is one problem: sources.

All sources of those information, were took from blogs and websites about [Zelda](http://zelda.com/ "official website"), so how can we tell they're true? Well, I searched a little bit about the sources, I spent like 5 hours searching where the first quote was from, and I found out that it came from an exclusive interview with [Miyamoto](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shigeru_Miyamoto "Shigeru Miyamoto on Wikip√©dia") to a magazine called [Nintendo Power](http://nintendopower.com/ "official website") in November of 1998, [**click here**](http://www.miyamotoshrine.com/theman/interviews/111998.shtml "miyamotoshrine.com") to read it.

This interview was published on January of 1999 in a special edition of [Nintendo Power](http://nintendopower.com/ "Official website") #116, the edition that only who have a subscription of the magazine gets it. I searched on eBay for that special edition but I didn't find it =( So I e-mailed [Nintendo Power](http://nintendopower.com/ "official website") and [Nintendo](http://nintendo.com/ "Official website") with the link of the interview, asking if it's really true, and they answered yes!

So the first quote about Ocarina of Time being the first [Zelda](http://zelda.com/ "Official website") ever it's true and was [Miyamoto](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shigeru_Miyamoto "Shigeru Miyamoto on Wikip√©dia") himself who said it =D The source of the second quote was a lot easier to find, I searched on the official website of [Nintendo Dream](http://www.nindori.com/ "Official website"), japanese magazine of [Nintendo](http://nintendo.com/ "Official website"), and I found the edition that has that quote, to access the interview (in japanese) [**click here**](http://www.nindori.com/interview/154zelda/154int_02.html "Nintendo Dream"), and to see the translation (english by [Google translator](http://translate.google.com/translate_t?hl=pt-br# "Tradutor da Google") ) [**click here**](http://translate.google.com.br/translate?hl=pt-BR&sl=ja&tl=en&u=http://www.nindori.com/interview/154zelda/154int_02.html "Nintendo Dream").

You can also check the translated version by Patricia and TSA, from [thehylia.com/](http://www.thehylia.com/) by [**clicking here**](http://www.thehylia.com/index.php?subaction=showfull&id=1173582355 "Translation").

There, job done! -#Zelda POSSESSES a timeline#-, we only have to wait for [Mr. Miyamoto](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shigeru_Miyamoto "Shigeru Miyamoto on Wikip√©dia") to start launching new games of [Zelda](http://zelda.com/ "Official website") that are connected to the ones that already exist.

[Zelda](http://zelda.com/ "Official website") is an adventure game, really rich in puzzles, which, for who is more addicted to it, brings a fantasy story like no other before.

We'll keep on playing [Zelda](http://zelda.com/ "Official website") to the end of times o/

Also check out [the Zelda Timeline secret page I have on this blog](/en/zelda-timeline).

messages.title: T√≠tulo
messages.author: @thepiratepablo
messages.e3_paragraph_1: Esta p√°gina j√° contou com uma contagem regressiva para o pr√≥ximo evento E3, um momento que in√∫meros jogadores e profissionais da ind√∫stria aguardavam ansiosamente a cada ano. E3 n√£o era apenas um evento; era uma celebra√ß√£o da nossa paix√£o compartilhada por videogames, um lugar onde sonhos se realizavam e mem√≥rias eram feitas.
messages.e3_paragraph_2: Desde os an√∫ncios eletrizantes at√© as demos pr√°ticas, a E3 era o cora√ß√£o do mundo dos jogos. Ela reunia pessoas de todos os cantos do globo, unidas pelo amor aos jogos. Para muitos, era uma chance de conhecer seus her√≥is, descobrir novos t√≠tulos e experimentar a emo√ß√£o das √∫ltimas inova√ß√µes em tecnologia de jogos.
messages.e3_paragraph_3: No entanto, √† medida que o cen√°rio dos jogos evoluiu, tamb√©m evoluiu a maneira como nos conectamos e celebramos nossa paix√£o. Embora a E3 tenha chegado ao fim, o esp√≠rito de excita√ß√£o e comunidade que ela promoveu continua vivo. Agora esperamos por novas maneiras de nos reunir, compartilhar nosso amor pelos jogos e criar novas mem√≥rias.
messages.e3_paragraph_4: Embora a contagem regressiva tenha acabado, o legado da E3 permanecer√° para sempre em nossos cora√ß√µes, nos lembrando das jornadas incr√≠veis que fizemos e dos la√ßos que formamos ao longo do caminho.

messages.game.dialogs.npc_01.02: O qu√™, voc√™ n√£o sabe onde est√°?
messages.game.dialogs.npc_01.03: N√£o seja bobo, voc√™ est√° na Cidade P√°gina Inicial, lembra?
